content.description: Stand start matched on a really thin crimp. Move straight up to the lip and traverse left to top out.
content.location: It is on the backside of the Entrance Boulder.

content.description: Stand start on the far right arête with a good, high left side pull and your right hand on the arete
content.location: On the backside of the Entrance Boulder. Start about 10 feet right of the problem Eye Candy. This is on your right about 150 feet before the first Bob Johnson Boulder.

content.description: Sit start using the obvious rock for feet and hands matched on the lowest half-pad crimp. Move left hand up to another half-pad crimp, and then crank hard to a far away slot and then top out straight up.
content.location: This is on the undercut side of the Entrance Boulder, a 13 foot boulder you pass by on your right about 150 feet before you get to the first Bob Johnson Boulder.

content.description: Stand start about 5-6 feet right of the problem Global Warming and climb straight up.
content.location: This is on the undercut side of the Entrance Boulder...the 13 foot boulder on your right about 150 feet before the first Bob Johnson Boulder.

content.description: Sit start on the backside of the Entrance Boulder on the gently overhanging face and make some very crimpy moves to a final toss to the left arête without dabbing.
content.location: On the Entrance Boulder which is on your right about 150 feet before the first Bob Johnson Boulder.

content.description: This is really a small group of boulders very close to Dungeon Rock Road. You can see them when you first turn onto the Bob Johnson trail. As you walk towards Bob Johnson Boulder #1, these are on your right.
